conference.name: 22nd International Conference on Managed Programming Languages & Runtimes
conference.description: A premier forum for presenting and discussing novel results in all aspects of managed programming languages and runtime systems.

topics: Managed languages (e.g., Java, Scala, JavaScript, Python, Ruby, C#, F#, Clojure, Groovy, Kotlin, R, Smalltalk, Racket, Rust, Go, Lua, MATLAB, Raku, Pony)
Portable intermediate representations (e.g., JVM, WebAssembly, RPython)
Managed runtime systems (e.g., GraalVM, Android Runtime, V8, JavaScriptCore, .NET)
VMs for mobile and embedded devices
Compiler and program verification and model checking

contact.name: Tomoharu Ugawa
contact.email: ugawa ci i u-tokyo ac jp

submission_categories.description: Describing novel contributions involving managed language platforms.
submission_categories.format: up to 12 pages, excluding bibliography and appendix

submission_categories.description: Describing hot topics or promising new ideas.
submission_categories.format: up to 6 pages, excluding bibliography and appendix

submission_categories.description: Presenting technical challenges and solutions for managed language platforms.
submission_categories.format: up to 6 pages, excluding bibliography and appendix; up to 12 pages allowed if justified by content

publication.policy: Accepted submissions will be published in the ACM Digital Library, except if the authors prefer not to be included.
publication.prior_publication_policy: MPLR 2025 submissions must conform to the ACM Policy on Prior Publication and Simultaneous Submissions and to the SIGPLAN Republication Policy.
publication.poster_session: MPLR 2025 will not hold its own poster session.

author_instructions.format: ACM SIGPLAN format with the sigplan style.
author_instructions.latex_instructions: Use the acmart document class with the sigplan option. Include page numbers in your submission.
author_instructions.submission_format: All submissions need to be in PDF format.

conference.publication_date_note: The official publication date may be up to two weeks prior to the first day of your conference.
